questions.question: The house was ……………………………… in the quake.
questions.description: When past participles are used like adjectives/adverbs, they have a passive meaning. A damaged house is a house that had been damaged.

questions.question: It was …………………………….. in the storm.
questions.description: When past participles are used like adjectives/adverbs, they have a passive meaning.

questions.question: The new office is going to be ……………………… in June.
You are ………………………..
questions.description: Here also the meaning is passive because something is being done to the subject.

questions.question: Who is that pretty girl …………………………… in the corner?
questions.description:
When present participles are used like adjectives or adverbs, they have an active meaning.
Girl sitting is the girl who is sitting.

questions.question: Most of the people ……………………….. to the wedding didn’t turn up.
questions.description: When past participles are used like adjectives/adverbs, they have a passive meaning. People invited are the people who were invited.

questions.question: Your explanation made me very ………………………….
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: The ……………………………. prisoner has been caught.
questions.description: When past participles are used like adjectives/adverbs, they have a passive meaning. People invited are the people who were invited.

questions.question: He lived alone, …………………………… by everybody.
questions.description: When past participles are used like adjectives/adverbs, they have a passive meaning. He had been forgotten by everybody.

questions.question: The above ………………………….. point deserves special attention.
questions.description: The above mentioned point is a point that has been mentioned.

questions.question: His idea seems ……………………………
questions.description: The present participle is used to describe people or things that cause the feelings mentioned in the sentence.

questions.question: The children were terribly ………………………… when they received the gifts.
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.
